meanings.definition: Syncarps: Fused fruits formed from multiple ovaries.
meanings.sent1: The syncarps on the tree were a mix of different fruits grown together.
meanings.sent2: The market sold syncarps that combined the flavors of various fruits.
meanings.sent3: The syncarps looked like a fruity puzzle put together by nature.
meanings.sent4: Her garden produced syncarps that seemed like a fruit medley in one.
meanings.sent5: The syncarps hanging from the branches were a colorful mosaic of fruits.

meanings.definition: Syncarps: A group of fruits that develop from a single flower.
meanings.sent1: Each syncarps cluster on the plant originated from a single bloom.
meanings.sent2: The syncarps from the rose bush bloomed beautifully in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The syncarps from the flower looked like a fruity family reunion.
meanings.sent4: The syncarps were like siblings, sharing the same floral roots.
meanings.sent5: The syncarps were a bouquet of fruits born from a single flower.
